[not_tested]: https://img.shields.io/badge/Status-Non_testé-red.svg?style=flat-square&logo=data:image/svg+xml;base64,
[in_progress]: https://img.shields.io/badge/Status-En_cours_de_test-yellow.svg?style=flat-square&logo=data:image/svg+xml;base64,
[tested]: https://img.shields.io/badge/Status-Testé-green.svg?style=flat-square&logo=data:image/svg+xml;base64,
[rex]: https://img.shields.io/badge/Status-REX-blue.svg?style=flat-square&logo=data:image/svg+xml;base64,
[tutorial]: https://img.shields.io/badge/Status-Tutoriel-blue.svg?style=flat-square&logo=data:image/svg+xml;base64,
[blog]: https://blog.zatsit.fr
# Contribute to this list of awesome tools

If you would like to add technical tools (libraries / frameworks / etc) to this list,
simply submit a [Pull Request](https://github.com/zatsit-oss/awesome-impact-tools/pulls) following these guidelines:

- The proposal must contain a technical tool, enabling impact measurement.
- It must fit into the current [README](./README.md) file.
    - Be associated with the right categories
    - Containing a **zatsit** badge, related to the current status of the tool analysis. See [here](#adding-a-zatsit-badge) for how to.
    - Containing a technology badge, related to the technology used by the tool, when possible. See [here](#adding-a-technology-badge) for how to.
    - Contain a link to its documentation, as well as a clear description of the tool's objectives.
- Your PR commit must be based on [conventional commits](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/)

## Adding badges

Adding badges to your tool description must follow the following syntax:

```markdown
 [tool description].<br/> [technology badge] [zatsit badge]
```

### Adding a technology badge

If you need a technology badge, you can pick a badge from [markdown-badges](https://github.com/Ileriayo/markdown-badges).
Just copy/past the badge URL and add it to your proposal, according to the existing content.

### Adding a **zatsit** badge (mandatory)

The available **zatsit** badges are already defined on top of the [README](./README.md) file. 
You can use them as follows:

```markdown
![z-status][not_tested]
or
![z-status][in_progress]
or
![z-status][tested]
or
![z-status][rex]
or
![z-status][tutorial]
```
When to use each badge?
- ![z-status][not_tested]: You are proposing a tool that you have not tested yet.
- ![z-status][in_progress]: Useful when a tool requires many time (some weeks for example) to be tested.
- ![z-status][tested]: The tool has been deep tested. This test should enable you to write a blog post or a tutorial on our [blog] .
- ![z-status][rex]: A REX (blog post) exists on our [blog]. The blogpost link must be attached to the badge, following this example:

Example: [![z-status][rex]](https://blog.zatsit.fr/blog/asyncapi-3-is-out)
```
[![z-status][rex]](https://blog.zatsit.fr/blog/asyncapi-3-is-out)
```

- ![z-status][tutorial]: A tutorial exists on our [blog]. The tutorial link must be attached to the badge, following this example:


Example: [![z-status][tutorial]](https://blog.zatsit.fr/blog/asyncapi-3-is-out)
```
[![z-status][tutorial]](https://blog.zatsit.fr/docs/asyncapi-3-is-out)
```
